title: Reporting people for verbal abuse
body: So I just got stuck in a game with a 4 man premade and was abused all game for asking the Riven who had died 8 times in 13 minutes to stop going in 1v4. They were basically constant all game, and then reported me at the end of the game. I also reported all of them, but we all know that means nothing. I have screenshots of the entire chat, but I feel like it will make no difference. Will posting it here actually have someone from riot read it and take action?

replies.body:
Are chat restrictions a good thing? Chat is still a valuable communication tool and if someone cant chat that  make sit harder to communicate. I think it would be better if there werent chat restrictions for this reason. Someone that uses bad or abusive language should have a real penalty like temporary ban and for the repeat offenders a permaban.

Sometimes i think it would be nice if there was a symbol on loading screen to show people that are on a chat restriction so the rest of the team know that person(s) cant write anything. Then we dont get annoyed because they wont respond to questions etc. It would save a bit of agro.
Before you go around calling people names you should try and at least learn the difference between "your" and "you're", you just end up looking like an illiterate asshole yourself.
maybe you shouldn't tell people how to enjoy their video games?

Hey Hefty Gentleman,

I'm sorry you had to go through that experience. Reporting players definitely does feed into our punishment systems. You can read more about our player behaviour systems here: http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/L65wrRYe-player-behaviour-faq

I have quoted a few relevant sections below

> **What happens when you report someone?**
> 
> When a player is reported, the full report is recorded and stored for analysis by our behavior systems, including information about the reporter and the game.
> 
> Depending on the type of report, different systems will review the report and if there is negative behaviour over multiple games, it will hand out a penalty. As an example Verbal Abuse reports will be evaluated by the chat restriction system while Unskilled Player reports are only used for matchmaking analysis and wonâ€™t result in a penalty on your account.
> 
> **Chat Restriction System**
> 
> **What is a chat restriction?**
> 
> Chat Restrictions are an upgrade to standard bans we designed with the goal of improving and reforming the behavior of players who create negative experiences in League.
> 
> **What does a chat restriction do?**
> 
> A chat restriction applies a temporary chat limitation to your account for a set number of games. This means players who are chat restricted will only be able to interact with their teams through gameplay, pings, and very limited messaging opportunities.
> 
> **How does the system work?**
> 
> Chat restrictions take multiple reports over a series of games into account. Players with normal behaviour will never be affected, and there are a number of protections in place that sort out false reports, premade abuse, and other potential issues.
> 
> If a player is continuously displaying negative behaviour they will then receive chat restrictions on that account.
> 
> You can find more information about Chat Restrictions in the knowledge base article: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752984-Restricted-Chat-Mode
